org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.io

Interface Allocator


  • public interface Allocator
    An allocator provided externally to storage classes to allocate MemoryBuffer-s.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Allocator.AllocatorOutOfMemoryException 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void allocateMultiple(MemoryBuffer[] dest, int size)
      Allocates multiple buffers of a given size.
      MemoryBuffer createUnallocated()
      Creates an unallocated memory buffer object.
      void deallocate(MemoryBuffer buffer)
      Deallocates a memory buffer.
      int getMaxAllocation()
      Maximum allocation size supported by this allocator.
      boolean isDirectAlloc()
      Whether the allocator uses direct buffers.

    • Method Detail

      • allocateMultiple

        void allocateMultiple(MemoryBuffer[] dest,
                      int size)
               throws Allocator.AllocatorOutOfMemoryException
        Allocates multiple buffers of a given size.
        Parameters:
        dest - Array where buffers are placed. Objects are reused if already there (see createUnallocated), created otherwise.
        size - Allocation size.
        Throws:
        Allocator.AllocatorOutOfMemoryException - Cannot allocate.

      • createUnallocated

        MemoryBuffer createUnallocated()
        Creates an unallocated memory buffer object. This object can be passed to allocateMultiple to allocate; this is useful if data structures are created for separate buffers that can later be allocated together.

      • deallocate

        void deallocate(MemoryBuffer buffer)
        Deallocates a memory buffer.

      • isDirectAlloc

        boolean isDirectAlloc()
        Whether the allocator uses direct buffers.

      • getMaxAllocation

        int getMaxAllocation()
        Maximum allocation size supported by this allocator.
